Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

You put the young to work at productive endeavors, and you make sure that society continues to function as it always has. However, a few of your group are not satisfied with this. They see the young as a resource to be exploited, and they want to take advantage of their numbers and their lack of free will. Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

They put them to work in factories, they put them to work in mines,  some of the old men even use the complaint young women as workers in brothels for their o

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

Although you are all very old, it is only natural that the members of the "Lost Generations" step in and supply leadership to the young, compliant population. It starts in a benign enough fashion. You and your cohorts are tasked with creating a new government, and you do so. You put the young to work at productive endeavors, and you make sure that society continues to function as it always has. However, a few of your group are not satisfied with this. They see the young as a resource to be exploited, and they want to take advantage of their numbers and their lack of free will. Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

They put them to work in factories, they put them to work in mines,  some of the old men even use the complaint young women as workers in brothels for their own amusement. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

Although you are all very old, it is only natural that the members of the "Lost Generations" step in and supply leadership to the young, compliant population. It starts in a benign enough fashion. You and your cohorts are tasked with creating a new government, and you do so. You put the young to work at productive endeavors, and you make sure that society continues to function as it always has. However, a few of your group are not satisfied with this. They see the young as a resource to be exploited, and they want to take advantage of their numbers and their lack of free will. Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

Although you are all very old, it is only natural that the members of the "Lost Generations" step in and supply leadership to the young, compliant population. It starts in a benign enough fashion. You and your cohorts are tasked with creating a new government, and you do so. You put the young to work at productive endeavors, and you make sure that society continues to function as it always has. However, a few of your group are not satisfied with this. They see the young as a resource to be exploited, and they want to take advantage of their numbers and their lack of free will. Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

They put them to work in factories, they put them to work in mines,  some of the old men even use the complaint young women as workers in brothels for their own amusement. They put them to work developing a new version of the drug, one that will not cause the side effects of the original, and that functions on the old. The young scientists, though lacking in free will, are still capable, and the new drug is developed in a matter of months, and works. Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve t

The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

Although you are all very old, it is only natural that the members of the "Lost Generations" step in and supply leadership to the young, compliant population. It starts in a benign enough fashion. You and your cohorts are tasked with creating a new government, and you do so. You put the young to work at productive endeavors, and you make sure that society continues to function as it always has. However, a few of your group are not satisfied with this. They see the young as a resource to be exploited, and they want to take advantage of their numbers and their lack of free will. Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

They put them to work developing a new version of the drug, one that will not cause the side effects of the original, and that functions on the old. The young scientists, though lacking in free will, are still capable, and the new drug is developed in a matter of months, and works. Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve them according to whatev

The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

They put them to work developing a new version of the drug, one that will not cause the side effects of the original, and that functions on the old. The young scientists, though lacking in free will, are still capable, and the new drug is developed in a matter of months, and works. Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve them according to whatever their sick, sometimes senile, whims may be.

The young scientists, though lacking in free will, are still capable, and the new drug is developed in a matter of months, and works. Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve them according to whatever their sick, sometimes senile, whims may be.

You, and some of the other "Lost Generation

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

Although you are all very old, it is only natural that the members of the "Lost Generations" step in and supply leadership to the young, compliant population. It starts in a benign enough fashion. You and your cohorts are tasked with creating a new government, and you do so. You put the young to work at productive endeavors, and you make sure that society continues to function as it always has. However, a few of your group are not satisfied with this. They see the young as a resource to be exploited, and they want to take advantage of their numbers and their lack of free will. Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

They put them to work in factories, they put them to work in mines,  some of the old men even use the complaint young women as workers in brothels for their own amusement. They put them to work developing a new version of the drug, one that will not cause the side effects of the original, and that functions on the old. The young scientists, though lacking in free will, are still capable, and the new drug is developed in a matter of months, and works. Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve them according to whatever their sick, sometimes senile, whims may be.

You, and some of the other "Lost Generation" members see this for t

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

You put the young to work at productive endeavors, and you make sure that society continues to function as it always has. However, a few of your group are not satisfied with this. They see the young as a resource to be exploited, and they want to take advantage of their numbers and their lack of free will. Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

They put them to work in factories, they put them to work in mines,  some of the old men even use the complaint young women as workers in brothels for their own amusement. They put them to work developing a new version of the drug, one that will not cause the side effects of the original, and that functions on the old. The young scientists, though lacking in free will, are still capable, and the new drug is developed in a matter of months, and works. Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve them according to whatever their sick, sometimes senile, whims may be.

You, and some of the other "Lost Generation" members see this for the atrocity it is, and you try to stop it. You put your own scientists to work developing yet an

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

Although you are all very old, it is only natural that the members of the "Lost Generations" step in and supply leadership to the young, compliant population. It starts in a benign enough fashion. You and your cohorts are tasked with creating a new government, and you do so. You put the young to work at productive endeavors, and you make sure that society continues to function as it always has. However, a few of your group are not satisfied with this. They see the young as a resource to be exploited, and they want to take advantage of their numbers and their lack of free will. Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

They put them to work in factories, they put them to work in mines,  some of the old men even use the complaint young women as workers in brothels for their own amusement. They put them to work developing a new version of the drug, one that will not cause the side effects of the original, and that functions on the old. The young scientists, though lacking in free will, are still capable, and the new drug is developed in a matter of months, and works. Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve them according to whatever their sick, sometimes senile, whims may be.

Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

They put them to work in factories, they put them to work in mines,  some of the old men even use the complaint young women as workers in brothels for their own amusement. They put them to work developing a new version of the drug, one that will not cause the side effects of the original, and that functions on the old. The young scientists, though lacking in free will, are still capable, and the new drug is developed in a matter of months, and works. Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve them according to whatever their sick, sometimes senile, whims may be.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

Although you are all very old, it is only natural that the members of the "Lost Generations" step in and supply leadership to the young, compliant population. It starts in a benign enough fashion. You and your cohorts are tasked with creating a new government, and you do so. You put the young to work at productive endeavors, and you make sure that society continues to function as it always has. However, a few of your group are not satisfied with this. They see the young as a resource to be exploited, and they want to take advantage of their numbers and their lack of free will. Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

They put them to work in factories, they put them to work in mines,  some of the old men even use the complaint young women as workers in brothels for their own amusement. They put them to work developing a new version of the drug, one that will not cause the side effects of the original, and that functions on the old. The young scientists, though lacking in free will, are still capable, and the new drug is developed in a matter of months, and works. Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve them according to whatever their sick, sometimes senile, whims may be.

Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

Although you are all very old, it is only natural that the members of the "Lost Generations" step in and supply leadership to the young, compliant population. It starts in a benign enough fashion. You and your cohorts are tasked with creating a new government, and you do so. You put the young to work at productive endeavors, and you make sure that society continues to function as it always has. However, a few of your group are not satisfied with this. They see the young as a resource to be exploited, and they want to take advantage of their numbers and their lack of free will. Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

They put them to work in factories, they put them to work in mines,  some of the old men even use the complaint young women as workers in brothels for their own amusement. They put them to work developing a new version of the drug, one that will not cause the side effects of the original, and that functions on the old. The young scientists, though lacking in free will, are still capable, and the new drug is developed in a matter of months, and works. Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve them according to whatever their sick, sometimes senile, whims may be.

You, and some of the other "Lost Generation" members see this for the atrocity it is, and you try to stop it. You put your own complaint scientists to work developing yet another drug, that will negate all the effects of the previously developed serum.

Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

Although you are all very old, it is only natural that the members of the "Lost Generations" step in and supply leadership to the young, compliant population. It starts in a benign enough fashion. You and your cohorts are tasked with creating a new government, and you do so. You put the young to work at productive endeavors, and you make sure that society continues to function as it always has. However, a few of your group are not satisfied with this. They see the young as a resource to be exploited, and they want to take advantage of their numbers and their lack of free will. Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

They put them to work in factories, they put them to work in mines,  some of the old men even use the complaint young women as workers in brothels for their own amusement. They put them to work developing a new version of the drug, one that will not cause the side effects of the original, and that functions on the old. The young scientists, though lacking in free will, are still capable, and the new drug is developed in a matter of months, and works. Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve them according to whatever their sick, sometimes senile, whims may be.

You, and some of the other "Lost Generation" members see this for the atrocity it is, and you try to stop it. You put your own complaint scientists to work developing yet another drug, that will negate all the effects of the previously developed serum.

You put the young to work at productive endeavors, and you make sure that society continues to function as it always has. However, a few of your group are not satisfied with this. They see the young as a resource to be exploited, and they want to take advantage of their numbers and their lack of free will. Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

They put them to work in factories, they put them to work in mines,  some of the old men even use the complaint young women as workers in brothels for their own amusement. They put them to work developing a new version of the drug, one that will not cause the side effects of the original, and that functions on the old. The young scientists, though lacking in free will, are still capable, and the new drug is developed in a matter of months, and works. Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve them according to whatever their sick, sometimes senile, whims may be.

You, and some of the other "Lost Generation" members see this for the atrocity it is, and you try to stop it. You put your own complaint scientists to work developing yet another drug, that will negate all the effects of the previously developed serum.

This drug also works; you introduce it to the world

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

Although you are all very old, it is only natural that the members of the "Lost Generations" step in and supply leadership to the young, compliant population. It starts in a benign enough fashion. You and your cohorts are tasked with creating a new government, and you do so. You put the young to work at productive endeavors, and you make sure that society continues to function as it always has. However, a few of your group are not satisfied with this. They see the young as a resource to be exploited, and they want to take advantage of their numbers and their lack of free will. Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

They put them to work in factories, they put them to work in mines,  some of the old men even use the complaint young women as workers in brothels for their own amusement. They put them to work developing a new version of the drug, one that will not cause the side effects of the original, and that functions on the old. The young scientists, though lacking in free will, are still capable, and the new drug is developed in a matter of months, and works. Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve them according to whatever their sick, sometimes senile, whims may be.

Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

They put them to work in factories, they put them to work in mines,  some of the old men even use the complaint young women as workers in brothels for their own amusement. They put them to work developing a new version of the drug, one that will not cause the side effects of the original, and that functions on the old. The young scientists, though lacking in free will, are still capable, and the new drug is developed in a matter of months, and works. Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve them according to whatever their sick, sometimes senile, whims may be.

You, and some of the other "Lost Generation" members see this for the atrocity it is, and you try to stop it. You put your own complaint scientists to work developing yet another drug, that will negate all the effects of the previously developed serum.

This drug also works; you introduce it to the world's populace as a gas, and before long the young regain their

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

They put them to work in factories, they put them to work in mines,  some of the old men even use the complaint young women as workers in brothels for their own amusement. They put them to work developing a new version of the drug, one that will not cause the side effects of the original, and that functions on the old. The young scientists, though lacking in free will, are still capable, and the new drug is developed in a matter of months, and works. Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve them according to whatever their sick, sometimes senile, whims may be.

You, and some of the other "Lost Generation" members see this for the atrocity it is, and you try to stop it. You put your own complaint scientists to work developing yet another drug, that will negate all the effects of the previously developed serum.

This drug also works; you introduce it to the world's populace as a gas, and before long the young regain their will, but lose their immortality, and the old start agi

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

Although you are all very old, it is only natural that the members of the "Lost Generations" step in and supply leadership to the young, compliant population. It starts in a benign enough fashion. You and your cohorts are tasked with creating a new government, and you do so. You put the young to work at productive endeavors, and you make sure that society continues to function as it always has. However, a few of your group are not satisfied with this. They see the young as a resource to be exploited, and they want to take advantage of their numbers and their lack of free will. Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

They put them to work in factories, they put them to work in mines,  some of the old men even use the complaint young women as workers in brothels for their own amusement. They put them to work developing a new version of the drug, one that will not cause the side effects of the original, and that functions on the old. The young scientists, though lacking in free will, are still capable, and the new drug is developed in a matter of months, and works. Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve them according to whatever their sick, sometimes senile, whims may be.

You, and some of the other "Lost Generation" members see this for the atrocity it is, and you try to stop it. You put your own complaint scientists to work developing yet another drug, that will negate all the effects of the previously developed serum.

This drug also works; you introduce it to the world's populace as a gas, and before long the young regain their will, but lose their immortality, and the old start aging normally again.

You, and some of the other "Lost Generation" members see this for the atrocity it is, and you try to stop it. You put your own complaint scientists to work developing yet another drug, that will negate all the effects of the previously developed serum.

This drug also works; you introduce it to the world's populace as a gas, and before long the young regain their will, but lose their immortality, and the old start aging normally again.

Close to 100 years

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

Although you are all very old, it is only natural that the members of the "Lost Generations" step in and supply leadership to the young, compliant population. It starts in a benign enough fashion. You and your cohorts are tasked with creating a new government, and you do so. They see the young as a resource to be exploited, and they want to take advantage of their numbers and their lack of free will. Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

Although you are all very old, it is only natural that the members of the "Lost Generations" step in and supply leadership to the young, compliant population. It starts in a benign enough fashion. You and your cohorts are tasked with creating a new government, and you do so. You put the young to work at productive endeavors, and you make sure that society continues to function as it always has. However, a few of your group are not satisfied with this. They see the young as a resource to be exploited, and they want to take advantage of their numbers and their lack of free will. Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

They put them to work in factories, they put them to work in mines,  some of the old men even use the complaint young women as workers in brothels for their own amusement. They put them to work developing a new version of the drug, one that will not cause the side effects of the original, and that functions on the old. The young scientists, though lacking in free will, are still capable, and the new drug is developed in a matter of months, and works. Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve them according to whatever their sick, sometimes senile, whims may be.

You, and some of the other "Lost Generation" members see this for the atrocity it is, and you try to stop it. You put your own complaint scientists to work developing yet another drug, that will negate all the effects of the previously developed serum.

This drug also works; you introduce it to the world's populace as a gas, and before long the young regain their will, but lose their immortality, and the old start aging normally again.

They put them to work in factories, they put them to work in mines,  some of the old men even use the complaint young women as workers in brothels for their own amusement. They put them to work developing a new version of the drug, one that will not cause the side effects of the original, and that functions on the old. The young scientists, though lacking in free will, are still capable, and the new drug is developed in a matter of months, and works. Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve them according to whatever their sick, sometimes senile, whims may be.

You, and some of the other "Lost Generation" members see this for the atrocity it is, and you try to stop it. You put your own complaint scientists to work developing yet another drug, that will negate all the effects of the previously developed serum.

This drug also works; you introduce it to the world's populace as a gas, and before long the young regain their will, but lose their immortality, and the old start aging normally again.

Close to 100 years old, you are hailed as a hero by the people.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

The young scientists, though lacking in free will, are still capable, and the new drug is developed in a matter of months, and works. Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve them according to whatever their sick, sometimes senile, whims may be.

You, and some of the other "Lost Generation" members see this for the atrocity it is, and you try to stop it. You put your own complaint scientists to work developing yet another drug, that will negate all the effects of the previously developed serum.

This drug also works; you introduce it to the world's populace as a gas, and before long the young regain their will, but lose their immortality, and the old start aging normally again.

Close to 100 years old, you are hailed as a hero by the Earth's people.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

Although you are all very old, it is only natural that the members of the "Lost Generations" step in and supply leadership to the young, compliant population. It starts in a benign enough fashion. You and your cohorts are tasked with creating a new government, and you do so. You put the young to work at productive endeavors, and you make sure that society continues to function as it always has. However, a few of your group are not satisfied with this. They see the young as a resource to be exploited, and they want to take advantage of their numbers and their lack of free will. Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve them according to whatever their sick, sometimes senile, whims may be.

You, and some of the other "Lost Generation" members see this for the atrocity it is, and you try to stop it. You put your own complaint scientists to work developing yet another drug, that will negate all the effects of the previously developed serum.

This drug also works; you introduce it to the world's populace as a gas, and before long the young regain their will, but lose their immortality, and the old start aging normally again.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

The young scientists, though lacking in free will, are still capable, and the new drug is developed in a matter of months, and works. Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve them according to whatever their sick, sometimes senile, whims may be.

You, and some of the other "Lost Generation" members see this for the atrocity it is, and you try to stop it. You put your own complaint scientists to work developing yet another drug, that will negate all the effects of the previously developed serum.

This drug also works; you introduce it to the world's populace as a gas, and before long the young regain their will, but lose their immortality, and the old start aging normally again.

Close to 100 years old, you are hailed as a hero by the Earth's people, who are happy to return to li

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

They put them to work in factories, they put them to work in mines,  some of the old men even use the complaint young women as workers in brothels for their own amusement. They put them to work developing a new version of the drug, one that will not cause the side effects of the original, and that functions on the old. The young scientists, though lacking in free will, are still capable, and the new drug is developed in a matter of months, and works. Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve them according to whatever their sick, sometimes senile, whims may be.

You, and some of the other "Lost Generation" members see this for the atrocity it is, and you try to stop it. You put your own complaint scientists to work developing yet another drug, that will negate all the effects of the previously developed serum.

This drug also works; you introduce it to the world's populace as a gas, and before long the young regain their will, but lose their immortality, and the old start aging normally again.

Close to 100 years old, you are hailed as a hero by the Earth's people, who are happy to return to life as it was before

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

You and your cohorts are tasked with creating a new government, and you do so. You put the young to work at productive endeavors, and you make sure that society continues to function as it always has. However, a few of your group are not satisfied with this. They see the young as a resource to be exploited, and they want to take advantage of their numbers and their lack of free will. Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

They put them to work in factories, they put them to work in mines,  some of the old men even use the complaint young women as workers in brothels for their own amusement. They put them to work developing a new version of the drug, one that will not cause the side effects of the original, and that functions on the old. The young scientists, though lacking in free will, are still capable, and the new drug is developed in a matter of months, and works. Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve them according to whatever their sick, sometimes senile, whims may be.

You, and some of the other "Lost Generation" members see this for the atrocity it is, and you try to stop it. You put your own complaint scientists to work developing yet another drug, that will negate all the effects of the previously developed serum.

This drug also works; you introduce it to the world's populace as a gas, and before long the young regain their will, but lose their immortality, and the old start aging normally again.

Close to 100 years old, you are hailed as a hero by the Earth's people, who are happy to return to life as it was before the drug was devel

Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

Close to 100 years old, you are hailed as a hero by the Earth's people, who are happy to return to life as it was before the drug was developed. You know yo

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

Although you are all very old, it is only natural that the members of the "Lost Generations" step in and supply leadership to the young, compliant population. It starts in a benign enough fashion. You and your cohorts are tasked with creating a new government, and you do so. You put the young to work at productive endeavors, and you make sure that society continues to function as it always has. However, a few of your group are not satisfied with this. They see the young as a resource to be exploited, and they want to take advantage of their numbers and their lack of free will. Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

They put them to work in factories, they put them to work in mines,  some of the old men even use the complaint young women as workers in brothels for their own amusement. They put them to work developing a new version of the drug, one that will not cause the side effects of the original, and that functions on the old. The young scientists, though lacking in free will, are still capable, and the new drug is developed in a matter of months, and works. Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve them according to whatever their sick, sometimes senile, whims may be.

Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

Although you are all very old, it is only natural that the members of the "Lost Generations" step in and supply leadership to the young, compliant population. It starts in a benign enough fashion. You and your cohorts are tasked with creating a new government, and you do so. You put the young to work at productive endeavors, and you make sure that society continues to function as it always has. However, a few of your group are not satisfied with this. They see the young as a resource to be exploited, and they want to take advantage of their numbers and their lack of free will. Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

They put them to work in factories, they put them to work in mines,  some of the old men even use the complaint young women as workers in brothels for their own amusement. They put them to work developing a new version of the drug, one that will not cause the side effects of the original, and that functions on the old. The young scientists, though lacking in free will, are still capable, and the new drug is developed in a matter of months, and works. Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve them according to whatever their sick, sometimes senile, whims may be.

You, and some of the other "Lost Generation" members see this for the atrocity it is, and you try to stop it. You put your own complaint scientists to work developing yet another drug, that will negate all the effects of the previously developed serum.

This drug also works; you introduce it to the world's populace as a gas, and before long the young regain their will, but lose their immortality, and the old start aging normally again.

Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

Although you are all very old, it is only natural that the members of the "Lost Generations" step in and supply leadership to the young, compliant population. It starts in a benign enough fashion. You and your cohorts are tasked with creating a new government, and you do so. You put the young to work at productive endeavors, and you make sure that society continues to function as it always has. However, a few of your group are not satisfied with this. They see the young as a resource to be exploited, and they want to take advantage of their numbers and their lack of free will. Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

They put them to work in factories, they put them to work in mines,  some of the old men even use the complaint young women as workers in brothels for their own amusement. They put them to work developing a new version of the drug, one that will not cause the side effects of the original, and that functions on the old. The young scientists, though lacking in free will, are still capable, and the new drug is developed in a matter of months, and works. Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve them according to whatever their sick, sometimes senile, whims may be.

You, and some of the other "Lost Generation" members see this for the atrocity it is, and you try to stop it. You put your own complaint scientists to work developing yet another drug, that will negate all the effects of the previously developed serum.

This drug also works; you introduce it to the world's populace as a gas, and before long the young regain their will, but lose their immortality, and the old start aging normally again.

Close to 100 years old, you are hailed as a hero by the Earth's people, who are happy to return to life as it was before the drug was developed. You know you are too old to live much longer, but you are content with the knowledge that your memory will live on in the minds of humanity, f

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. As it turns out, the drug has caused the people who took it to lose their free will. The result of this is a world where the young are numerous, and healthy, and will live indefinitely, but lack motivation and volition.

Although you are all very old, it is only natural that the members of the "Lost Generations" step in and supply leadership to the young, compliant population. It starts in a benign enough fashion. You and your cohorts are tasked with creating a new government, and you do so. You put the young to work at productive endeavors, and you make sure that society continues to function as it always has. However, a few of your group are not satisfied with this. They see the young as a resource to be exploited, and they want to take advantage of their numbers and their lack of free will. Slowly, they insinuate tasks that are more and more morally questionable into your government's agenda.

They put them to work in factories, they put them to work in mines,  some of the old men even use the complaint young women as workers in brothels for their own amusement. They put them to work developing a new version of the drug, one that will not cause the side effects of the original, and that functions on the old. The young scientists, though lacking in free will, are still capable, and the new drug is developed in a matter of months, and works. Now it is guaranteed that the old will live forever, and the young will be there to serve them according to whatever their sick, sometimes senile, whims may be.
